instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no power.

Client said it stoped working over night.

It has green light, no fan spin and puls 0.2A from PSU.

<CAPACITOR>C7500</CAPACITOR>/03 are burnt, and the pads are also burnt (gone). <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> test pad is also missing.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 8.56V on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> pin 23

<SIGNAL>P5VP3V3_VREG3</SIGNAL> = 4.3V on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> pin 22

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Be sure to rebuild the traces correctly.
Did you resolder <CAPACITOR>C7503</CAPACITOR>?

Post <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> basic voltages; 23, 22, 12, 13, 29, 21.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
It was a bad trace rebuild.

TKS!
